Riddle School District
August 12 at 1:07 PM ·

The most recent State Guidance has come out. Riddle School District can open in person from grades K-3. If you are uncomfortable sending your K-3 student to school, please let us know at registration (August 17 and 18) and alternative learning options will be provided. Grades 4-12 will be through distance learning and will be more comprehensive than last spring. Daily attendance will be required, and grades will be traditional letter scale. The State has allowed us to do some limited, in-person instruction for students with critical needs, in small cohorts, for a limited time each week. We will be delaying the start of school until September 14th so that our staff can get everything set up. We will be reviewing our status monthly to determine if in-person re-opening is possible. Please understand that an outbreak in the area or in the schools could force us to convert to Distance Learning K-12. We are working out the details now and will update you as our plans are approved.

post_text: A Driver Education class (ODOT certified) through UCC Community Education is being offered from April 9 through May 21 at Riddle High School. The class is on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 6 to 8:30 p.m. Students who are 15 to 17 and complete the class with 80% or better can be taken to DMV and the driving test will be waived. Students can register for the class at Umpqua.edu/cwt or by calling 541-440-4668 or 541-440-7776. The class includes 30 hours of classroom instruction and 12 hours in the car (drive sessions are scheduled separately from class times). The fee for students 15 to 17 is $199 (or $124 for students who qualify for free/reduced fee lunch). The fee for students with a license or over age 18 is $379. The class fee includes books. Students must have their Oregon permit before class starts. Parent(s)/guardian(s) must attend the first night of the driver training class. This is a wonderful opportunity for our students. A minimum number of participating students is required. Sign up soon!

post_text: Robert (Bob) Matthews, a former teacher and administrator at Riddle High School, died November 15 at the age of 86. His service was held today at the Riddle Community Center. Bob taught Social Sciences and English here beginning in the early 1960’s. He was also a football coach, basketball coach, and baseball coach (from Little League to varsity as well as all-star teams) with several teams placing high in state tournaments. In the early 1970’s, Bob became Riddle’s assistant principal, guidance counselor, and curriculum director. After his retirement in the early 1990’s, he volunteered in the community and enjoyed traveling. Bob touched the lives of countless persons throughout Southern Oregon as a teacher, coach, administrator, mentor, and friend. He will be greatly missed.

Attached find an infographic about the disease, a letter from our superintendent, and a FACT sheet with basics of the disease. According to the CDC, HFMD is usually not serious, and nearly all people recover in 7 to 10 days. Young children are primarily affected by HFMD, but it may be seen in adults. Please remember to "cover" when coughing and wash hands frequently and appropriately.
